required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Everyday Practice With Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: Experience With Percutaneous Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation in Patients With Symptomatic Aortic Valve Disease in Two German Centers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this registry is to document the everyday practice in our centers with minimal invasive treatment of patients with aortic valve disease who were considered suitable for transfemoral aortic valve implantation by heart team.

detailed_description.textblock: The TAVI program in our center started on November 2007. As part of the national policy for quality assurance in medicine a detailed clinical characterization of the TAVI-population was required. Furthermore, a detailed description of the procedure and peri-procedural complications until discharge was required. In our center we designed and are routinely using a TAVI database which fulfills the authority requirements as well as has additional data needed for planning and documentation of TAVI procedure. Since there is already a considerable number of TAVI patients in this database we aim to perform statistical analyses answering different question in this filed.

secondary_outcome.description: defined according to BARC and VARC-2 classification

other_outcome.description: new unplanned hospital stay due to cardiovascular und cerebrovascular reasons
new unplanned hospital stay due to cardiovascular und cerebrovascular reasons

arm_group.description: all patients undergoing transcatheter aortic valve prostheses implantation

intervention.description: balloon-expandable and self-expandable aortic valve prostheses
intervention.other_name: CoreValve, CoreValveE, Sapien XT, Sapien S3, Lotus

study_pop.textblock: patients with aortic valve stenosis suitable for transfemoral transcatheter aortic valve implanation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aortic stenosis
- Intermediate-to-high risk for surgery
- Heart team decision
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to transfemoral TAVI procedure
